p: Coronaviruses (CoVs), members of the family Coronaviridae and subfamily Coronavirinae, are enveloped positive-strand RNA viruses that have glycoprotein spikes projecting from their viral envelopes and thus exhibit a corona or halo-like appearance [ 13]. A new strain of CoV was identified at the end of 2019, initially named 2019-nCoV (“n” denoting “novel”), which emerged during an outbreak in Wuhan, China [ 14].
